page.title: 07RELIGION AND SCHOOLS
page.content: The Anglican church of All Saints is served by the vicar who lives in the village.The small Roman Catholic church of The Assumption has Mass on Sundays,and is part of the parish of St.Laurence,Petersfield.A Methodist Chapel holds services on Sundays,including a Sunday School attended by 10 children. The Primary School has three classrooms.It was built in 1964 and has a big playing field,and a swimming pool.65 children attend the school,which has it's own kitchen where lunches are cooked for the children,as well as those at West Meon School. A Playschool is held at the village hall on 4 days a week.20 children attend aged between 2-5 years.
